title: 8 New Defendants To Take Stand As France Mass Rape Trial Resumes
content: The trial of a Frenchman who recruited dozens of strangers to rape his drugged wife at their home resumes on Monday, with the cases of eight new defendants to be examined in court.
summary: The trial of a Frenchman who recruited dozens of strangers to rape his drugged wife at their home resumes on Monday, with the cases of eight new defendants to be examined in court.

title: Austria's Alpine Refuges And Trails Crumble As Climate Warms
content: Experts say warmer temperatures across the Alps are accelerating glacier melt and thawing permafrost, the year-round ice that binds together giant slabs of rock.
summary: Experts say warmer temperatures across the Alps are accelerating glacier melt and thawing permafrost, the year-round ice that binds together giant slabs of rock.

title: Opinion: India To Africa, Calls For Britain To Pay Reparations Are Growing
content: Patrick Robinson, a UN judge, indicated last year that the United Kingdom may owe over $24 trillion in reparations for its role in the trans-Atlantic slave trade.
summary: Patrick Robinson, a UN judge, indicated last year that the United Kingdom may owe over $24 trillion in reparations for its role in the trans-Atlantic slave trade.

title: Two Days After Iranian Woman's Arrest For Stripping, Her Whereabouts Unknown
content: Two days ago, a video surfaced showing an Iranian woman stripping down to her underwear to protest harassment by the moral police at a university in Tehran.
summary: Two days ago, a video surfaced showing an Iranian woman stripping down to her underwear to protest harassment by the moral police at a university in Tehran.

title: How A DNA Test Revealed Two Women Were Swapped At Birth
content: Two families in the West Midlands are seeking compensation after a DNA test revealed two baby girls were switched at birth in an NHS hospital 55 years ago.

title: Democrat Mayor Demands Trump Pay $500,000 In Unpaid Bills For Rallies

title: Cassius, World's Largest Captive Crocodile, Dies In Australia
content: Cassius, the world's largest known crocodile in captivity, has died in a Queensland wildlife sanctuary in Australia.

title: "What Happens In Booth, Stays In Booth": Kamala Harris Banks On Women's Votes

title: Kamala Harris To Spend Election Night At Howard, The Black Harvard

title: Not Just Carbon Dioxide, Other Greenhouse Gases Are Too Warming The Planet
content: While carbon dioxide (CO2) is the best-known greenhouse gas, several others, including methane and nitrous oxide, are also driving global warming and altering the Earth's climate.

title: "Red Line Has Been Crossed": Canadian MP Condemns Attack On Hindu Temple

title: Volcanic Eruption In Indonesia Kills 10
content: At least six people died after a volcano in eastern Indonesia erupted several times overnight, officials said Monday, raising the alert level to the highest of a four-tiered system.

title: Dollar Dips As US Election Outcome Remains Uncertain, Fed Rate Cut Looms
content: The dollar slipped in Asia on Monday as investors braced for a potentially pivotal week for the global economy as the US chooses a new leader and, probably, cuts interest rates again with major implications for bond yields.
